backend.library
Class MediaFile

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              backend.library.LibraryObject
                  backend.library.MediaFile
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ImageFile
public abstract class MediaFile
extends LibraryObject

Every file we can display is a kind of MediaFile. To actually instantiate a media file, you must actually create the specific kind of MediaFile that represents the file -- there is no such thing as a "defualt MediaFile".

Author:
Carl Angiolillo TODO Corl plenty of out of memory errors mayybe you can load images on demand?

getPath

public java.lang.String getPath()
Returns the path (relative to the the library) of this media file. For example, the image "Ducks.jpg" in the category "Fowl" in the station "Birds" in the program "Enviornmental Science" would return the String "Data/Library/Enviornmental Science/Birds/Fowl/Ducks.jpg" Note that we will always use the Unix standard file seperators.

Returns:
A String of this file's pathname.
